title: Large Team Format
description: Workshop adaptations for teams of 13+ people
philosophy: Large teams require delegation and representation. The strength is massive diversity of perspective and parallel processing power. Success requires strong facilitation structure, async pre-work, and representative synthesis.

strengths: Can pursue many ideas in parallel
challenges: Not everyone can speak in plenary
Risk of disengagement for quiet participants
Time required for full participation is enormous
Synthesis of many voices is challenging
Subgroups may feel disconnected from whole

general_adaptations.facilitation: Highly structured with multiple facilitators. Use representatives. Heavy async pre-work.
general_adaptations.timing: Longer workshops or split across more sessions. Build in async work.
general_adaptations.participation: Representative groups for sync work, everyone contributes async
general_adaptations.games: Multiple parallel game instances, synthesis in plenary
general_adaptations.discussions: Fishbowl format, representative panels, async discussion boards
general_adaptations.synthesis: Multi-stage: groups synthesize, then representatives synthesize

W1_vision_quest.pre_work: Individuals submit 3 headlines async before workshop
W1_vision_quest.future_headlines: Groups of 4-5 curate best headlines, representatives present to plenary
W1_vision_quest.stakeholder_safari: Breakout rooms by stakeholder type, synthesis in plenary
W1_vision_quest.mission_discussion: Fishbowl with rotating participants, audience reacts via chat

W2_ethics_arena.pre_work: Individuals rank values async before workshop
W2_ethics_arena.dilemma_duel: Multiple parallel debates, then 'debate finals' with winners
W2_ethics_arena.value_auction: Representative bidders for stakeholder groups, others coach
W2_ethics_arena.boundary_discussion: Breakouts propose, plenary votes on each boundary

W4_agent_assembly.trading_cards: Groups create cards by domain, representatives present to plenary
W4_agent_assembly.skill_bingo: Department/domain teams play, inter-team bingo competition

W5_integration_celebration.demo_derby: Representative demos with audience participation awards
W5_integration_celebration.gratitude_circle: Written gratitudes shared anonymously, readings in plenary

G1_future_headlines.modification: Async pre-work + group curation + representative presentation

G2_stakeholder_safari.modification: Breakout rooms by stakeholder type, 4-6 people explore one stakeholder deeply

G4_dilemma_duel.modification: Tournament format - parallel debates, winners debate in finals
G4_dilemma_duel.benefit: Everyone participates, finals create shared experience

G5_value_auction.modification: Representatives bid on behalf of groups, groups coach via chat

G7_agent_trading_cards.modification: Domain groups create cards, all-hands draft selects team deck

G8_skill_bingo.modification: Inter-department competition, representatives play for their department

G9_architecture_pictionary.modification: Multiple parallel games, canonical diagram combines best elements

G11_gratitude_circle.modification: Written gratitude submission, anonymous readings by facilitator

between_workshop_work: Review and comment on draft artifacts
Provide feedback on breakout group outputs
async_components.async_discussion_boards: Use Slack/Teams channels or dedicated discussion boards for extended conversations
async_components.documentation: All sync activities documented and shared async for those who couldn't participate fully

representative_model.selection: Each breakout group selects a representative for plenary activities
representative_model.rotation: Rotate representatives between workshops so different people get plenary experience
representative_model.accountability: Representatives report back to their groups, groups can override
representative_model.coaching: Groups can send real-time coaching to representatives via chat

parallel_facilitation.lead_facilitator: Runs plenary sessions, coordinates overall flow
parallel_facilitation.breakout_facilitators: One per 6-8 people, runs breakout activities
parallel_facilitation.ai_facilitator: Supports lead facilitator, runs synthesis, administers questionnaires
parallel_facilitation.documentation_team: Captures outputs from all breakouts in real-time

facilitation_tips: Pre-assign breakout groups to avoid transition chaos
Use numbered breakout rooms for easy coordination
Have backup facilitators - people drop out
Use polls and reactions constantly to maintain engagement
Chat is your friend - people can participate without speaking
Record sessions for those who miss parts
Send daily summaries after each workshop
Create a 'parking lot' for ideas that can't be addressed in time

engagement_strategies.chat_participation: Actively monitor and highlight chat contributions
engagement_strategies.gallery_walks: Virtual gallery walks where people explore async submissions
engagement_strategies.audience_awards: Let audience vote on best ideas, funniest moments, etc.

success_indicators: Participation metrics show broad engagement (>80% active)
Breakout outputs are high quality and synthesizable
Final artifacts feel representative of the whole team
